full_text:
The 'Muslim Regiment' post is false and dangerous. Do not believe it

The headline clearly indicates this is a fact-check article about a potentially misleading social media post regarding a "Muslim Regiment".

Unfortunately, the HTML content provided does not include the full text of the article. The parsing instructions were followed meticulously, but the actual article body is missing from the HTML snippet. Without the complete text, I cannot extract the detailed explanation of why the post is considered false and dangerous.

The only additional context available is from the image caption, which mentions Major Abdul Rafey Khan of Garhwal Rifles, who was awarded Vir Chakra posthumously on Sept 17, 1965, for displaying "exemplary courage and devotion to duty and made the supreme sacrifice of his life."

To provide the complete fact-check content, I would need the full text of the article, which is not present in this HTML fragment.
title: Fact: It was found out that there was no Muslim regiment in the Indian army. Earlier, the Indian Army had caste-based division during the British era. In the British era, the Indian army was divided based on caste, not religion. Also, there were cases of Indian Muslims who not only fought in Post-Independence war against Pakistan but also won gallantry awards.
vclaim: A social media post about a "Muslim Regiment" has been deemed false and misleading Major Abdul Rafey Khan of Garhwal Rifles was awarded Vir Chakra posthumously in 1965 for his exemplary courage and sacrifice
